intro: Lappula subsessilis, commonly known as the narrowleaf lappula, is a flowering plant native to Eurasia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in late summer. Lappula subsessilis is often found in wet meadows and along riverbanks, where it thrives in sunny to partially shaded conditions.
